block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.74 percent; a six-month bill was 5.99 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.74 percent; a six-month bill was 5.99 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Barbados, $100 million of international offering, Baa2/A-/---. Credit Suisse First Boston.
Capital One Bank, $750 million of global notes in two parts, Baa2/BBB-/---. J.P. Morgan Securities and Salomon Smith Barney.
Centex Corp., $200 to $300 million intermediate bonds, Baa2/BBB/---. Chase Bank Hambrecht & Quist.
Hartford Financial Services, $500 million in two parts consisting of 5-year and 10-year notes, A2/A/---. CS First Boston and Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Mutual Group Ltd., $150 million of senior notes, Baa2/BBB+/---. Prudential Securities.
Republic of Uruguay, $200 to $250 million of global securities with maturities to be 10 or 20 years, Baa3/ BBB-/---. Chase Securities.
Wachovia, $500 million global notes due 2005, Aa3/ AA-/---. Merrill Lynch & Co. and Wachovia.
Source: MCM CorporateWatch Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT
TUESDAY
Charlotte, N.C., $69.8 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
New Jersey, $50 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Baltimore Water Waste, $70 million of water bonds. PaineWebber Inc.
Chicago, $50 million of debt securities for United Airlines. Salomon Smith Barney.
Clarkamas County, Ore., School District 62, $67.5 million of state general obligation bonds. Seattle-Northwest Securities Corp.
Delaware River and Bay Authority, $98.6 million of revenue bonds. Tucker Anthony Inc.
Illinois, $300 million of general obligation bonds. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Indiana Housing Finance Authority, $57.4 million of single-family multimortgage revenue bonds. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Massachusetts, $650 million of general obligation bonds. PaineWebber Inc.
Montgomery, Md.,, $50 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Wyoming Community Development Administration, $50 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch & Co.
